name: St. Narcissus of Jerusalem
summary: Narcissus was the bishop of Jerusalem in the late 2nd and early 3rd centuries. He was already an old man when he became bishop around the year 180. He is known for his holiness and for working to resolve the controversy over the date of Easter. According to tradition, he performed miracles, including turning water into oil for the church lamps. He temporarily retired from his see but was persuaded to return. He lived to be over 100 years old and is venerated as a saint.
